text: this asparagus soup is the perfect
example of route to fruit cooking I'm
going to use the whole stock I'm gonna
use the bottoms to make a stock the
middles for the soup itself and I'm
gonna garnish with the tips so I've
already made my asparagus stock which
basically means I took chicken stock the
tops of these leeks over here and the
bottoms of these asparagus over here and
I just simmer them together and what
that does is it just gives the stock
extra flavor and then I just strained it
out and this is what I've got so I've
been heating up my pot and I'm just
gonna start with my oil it's very hot
I'm gonna add a little bit of rice this
is what's gonna thicken the soup and by
giving it a little saute with the leeks
first it's just gonna give it a little
toasty flavor pepper season as you go so
that you can build layers of flavor
that's one of those things they teach
you in cooking school not that I ever
went to cooking school but I did learn
it from someone who did and then when
the leeks get nice and soft in the rice
is a little bit golden you're just gonna
add some of your stock not all of it
just a little bit of it I know I'm just
gonna let this cook until leeks are
really tender and the rice is almost
completely tender
and now I'm gonna add the asparagus so
I'm just gonna let this cook just until
the asparagus are tender should take
about 7 to 10 minutes I'm just gonna
test the asparagus and yep that fork
slips are right in but it's not totally
mushy so that's just right over here I
have a food mill a food mill is a great
way to puree something when you want to
keep a little bit of the texture which
is good because you don't want it to be
like baby food you want just a little
bit of a bite if you use a food
processor or blender that's fine too
just don't overdo it
and then I'm just gonna scrape the
bottom as you go and I'm just gonna put
this right back in the pot to reheat it
and season it the most important part of
making the soup I think is getting the
seasonings right because if it's bland
or a little bit flat you know you need
to bring out the flavor of the asparagus
so salt it well and then lemon and I'm
just adding a pinch of tarragon here and
I'm also gonna use tarragon later
because I'm gonna serve this soup with
some ricotta crostini which is super
simple you just take a baguette you
toast it you rub it while it's still
warm with a cut garlic clove and then
you mix ricotta with a little bit of
tarragon salt and pepper and you put it
on top and it's ready to serve
ladle some in a bowl so these are my
asparagus tips and all I've done is just
blanched them really quickly just so
they're just tender and I'm just gonna
use them as garnish right here right in
the ball and then every time you scoop
some up sometimes you're just gonna get
smooth soup and sometimes you're gonna
get this lovely bite of asparagus it's a
really nice texture if you think about
it this is like the springtime version
of a wintery tomato soup with a grilled
cheese sandwich just dunk it right in
there
